results.title: At U.N., Biden Calls for Diplomacy, not Conflict, but Some Are Skeptical
results.abstract: The president said he wants global cooperation to meet challenges, but some allies and adversaries say his actions point to confrontation with China and unilateral action, belying his words.

results.title: Australia’s Submarines Make Waves in Asia Long Before They Go to Sea
results.abstract: Some nations fear an accelerated arms buildup in a region where larger countries have already ramped up their military spending or capabilities.

geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

results.abstract: The prime minister struggled to find a campaign issue that could distinguish his party and expand its power in Parliament.
results.byline: By Ian Austen and Dan Bilefsky

results.title: Pakistan Laments Cricket Matches Unplayed, and Blames Politics
results.abstract: Many see the pullouts by the England and New Zealand teams as punishment for the country’s support of the Afghan Taliban.

results.title: In Spain, Abortions Are Legal, but Many Doctors Refuse to Perform Them
results.abstract: Many physicians in the country call themselves “conscientious objectors” and deny the procedures, often forcing women to travel long distances for one.

multimedia.caption: “It’s one thing if you think abortion is right or wrong; each person will have their own criteria,” said Dr. María Jesús Barco, a gynecologist from Zaragoza who is an objector. “It’s another thing if I have to do it. That’s different.”
multimedia.copyright: Ana María Arévalo Gosen for The New York Times

results.title: U.K. Police Charge 3rd Man in Effort to Kill Russian Dissident
results.abstract: The authorities added a suspect in the attempted assassination of Sergei V. Skripal in 2018. Separately, a European court blamed Russia for Alexander V. Litvinenko’s murder in 2006.
results.byline: By Michael Schwirtz and Cora Engelbrecht

multimedia.caption: A police tent covers the spot where the former Russian spy Sergei V. Skripal and his daughter were found poisoned on a bench in 2018.

results.title: Sudan Leaders Say They Thwarted Coup Attempt by Loyalists of Former Dictator
results.abstract: Government officials blamed the bid on supporters of longtime ruler Omar Hassan al-Bashir, who was overthrown in 2019 by a military takeover prompted by widespread popular protests.
des_facet: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

multimedia.caption: Sudan’s capital, Khartoum, on Tuesday. Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok said the attempted coup was an effort by military and civilian elements to halt the transition to democracy.

results.title: Germany’s Far Right Is Nowhere in the Election. But It’s ‘Here to Stay.’
results.abstract: In the next national Parliament, the far-right Alternative for Germany party is likely to remain a pariah force. But it looks assured, too, of a role in shaping the country’s future.

multimedia.caption: Supporters of the far-right Alternative for Germany party, or AfD, at a rally last month. The party’s popularity has slipped since the last elections, but the AfD looks likely to stay in Parliament.

results.abstract: “There is a man-made drought of vaccines ravaging poor countries,” the Philippines leader told the U.N. General Assembly in prerecorded remarks.

results.title: China Pledges to Stop Building Coal-Burning Power Plants Abroad
results.abstract: It marks a major shift for one of the biggest backers of coal-fired plants globally. Still, China remains heavily reliant on new coal plants at home, and is the world’s top emitter of greenhouse gases.
results.byline: By Somini Sengupta and Rick Gladstone

results.abstract: Dr. Nkengasong will be the first person of African origin to oversee the U.S. government program combating H.I.V., which has ravaged the continent.

results.title: A Caribbean Island’s Audacious Tourism Experiment
results.abstract: To step onto Montserrat’s volcanic beaches, 21 travelers (so far) with an income of at least $70,000 have agreed to stay two months. The goal: to keep cash coming in, while keeping Covid away.
